history.question: In which year did World War II end?
history.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 following the surrender of Germany and Japan.

history.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
history.explanation: George Washington was the first President, serving from 1789 to 1797.

history.question: Which ancient civilization built the pyramids?
history.explanation: The ancient Egyptians constructed the pyramids as tombs for their pharaohs.

history.question: What was the name of the ship the Pilgrims sailed on to reach America in 1620?
history.explanation: The Pilgrims traveled on the Mayflower when they arrived in present-day Massachusetts.

history.question: Who was known as the 'Maid of Orléans'?
history.explanation: Joan of Arc earned the title 'Maid of Orléans' after leading the French army to victory during the Hundred Years' War.

history.question: Which empire was ruled by Genghis Khan?
history.explanation: Genghis Khan founded and ruled the Mongol Empire, one of the largest empires in history.

history.question: What wall divided East and West Germany until 1989?
history.explanation: The Berlin Wall physically and ideologically divided East and West Germany until it fell in 1989.

history.question: Who discovered penicillin?
history.explanation: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928, revolutionizing modern medicine.

history.question: Which war was fought between the North and South regions of the United States?
history.explanation: The American Civil War was fought from 1861 to 1865 between the Union (North) and Confederacy (South).

history.question: What ancient structure is located in modern-day Iraq and considered one of the earliest cities?
history.explanation: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon were located in ancient Mesopotamia, near present-day Iraq.
